item.title: NCAE 2025 Kickoff
item.description: Calling all beginners! The National Centers of Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C) has announced their 2025 season for the NCAE Cyber Games! For the past several years, the Wilmington University Cyberwildcats have competed in this excellent event for the benefit of our students. This activity is much like the red-vs-blue …
item.dc:creator: The Coach

item.title: Guest Lab on BGP and Internet Security
item.description: As announced in our Slack space, our friend Warren from Pros V Joes is back with hands on lab experience for the Cyberwildcats! This tutorial will look at current tools/techniques, how rPKI is just a piece in the puzzle, and what we should do to secure the internet routing …
item.dc:creator: The Coach

item.title: Guest Speaker on BGP and Internet Security
item.description: Great news! One of our friends at Pros V Joes has agreed to give a presentation to the Cyberwildcats, entitled, "BGP Hijacking and Secure Internet Routing". Our guest speaker, who goes by WarrenTheITGuy, will explore the complexities of BGP hijacking and its impacts on internet routing, with a focus on …
item.dc:creator: The Coach

item.title: Next meeting is November 18, 2023
item.description: As announced yesterday on our Slack and our Google Group, our next meeting is today at 1:00PM ET. We're going to have a jam-packed session, discussing upcoming Cyberwildcats CTFs, a discussion of the MITRE ATT&CK Framework and how cyber adversaries operate, a sneak peak at the talk of …
item.dc:creator: The Coach

item.title: Welcome to the new Cyberwildcats.net!
item.description: Well, it's been a little while since our old Wordpress site went down and I stood up an emergency HTML page to provide the most minimal of websites, but at long last here is our new site! This has been built using Pelican and Github Pages This new facility will …
